result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin S Perry II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:35 Defendant Kevin S Perry in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  Per DA - VR complied.  Ct - both parties have time to read both PSI's.  Per DA - he had not reviewed the 2nd PSI, which came in the mail on 12/27/16.  Break.  2:55 back on record.  DA satisfied with both PSI's.  Atty Weber satisfied.  Parties stipulate to 30 days to modify restitution request by DM.  3:02 RG - Victim addresses ct.  AG - Victim addresses ct.  DM - Victim addresses ct.  3:21 DA Steffen addresses CT.  3:46 Atty Weber addresses ct.  3:59 DE addresses Ct.  4:05 break.  4:20 back on record. 5:15 adj.  

SENTENCING: 
Count 1 -  I/S 10 years - 5 in/5 ES.  Probation of 5 years.  1 year conditional jail time.  9 months in.  without good time, and with work release for work and for treatment.  Jail time to start today 12/28/2016.  DNA Sample with $250.00 surcharge.  $290.60 court costs.  Rest. paid through probation, j/s with Hoglund and Kruse.   No contact with CMS.  No contact with the Goulet's and No contact with CMS's mother. 15 years SO Registry.  DE Not eligible for boot camp or SAP program.  Can not posses firearm.  Can not vote.  Can be deported.  Court does not object to moving probation to Texas.  

Count 6  - 10 years - 5 initial/5 ES - I/S.  both withheld.  Probation of 5  years.  DNA Sample with $250.00 surcharge.  $290.60 court costs.   1 year conditional time - banked - work release for work and for treatment, and no good time.  No credit for time served.  DE to start jail time today.  Rest. paid through probation, j/s with Hoglund and Kruse.   No contact with CMS.  No contact with the Goulet's and No contact with CMS's mother. 

Restitution - DA has 60 days to finalize.  Atty Weber has 30 days after.  $1306.00 property and $6,505.34 damages for a total of $7,811.34, along with a $781.13 surcharge.
